agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in
site_eligibility: Living in Marion area

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Grant County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies
site_eligibility: Varies
Victims and witnesses of crimes in Grant County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_name: GRANT COUNTY PROSECUTOR - CHILD SUPPORT DIVISION
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Grant County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Grant County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for their respective county, including performing the following duties: controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handles appeal of township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call or walk in for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 10am -- (Meetings held on Tues if a Mon is a holiday)

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 10am -- (Meetings held on Tues if a Mon is a holiday)

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Grant County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices

site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election
Open

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Grant County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Grant County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Grant County)

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.

site_eligibility: Age 16 or older -- Not enrolled in high school (documentation required for ages 16-17)

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides door-to-door transportation throughout the city of Marion for those with documented disabilities. Personal caregivers or assistants are permitted. All buses are fully wheelchair accessible. Registration is required before transportation may be offered.
site_details: To enroll: Visit website or walk in to obtain an application, or call the office to request that one be sent by mail. -- Return completed application in person or by mail. -- To schedule a ride (if approved): Call the bus terminal; reservations must be made at least 24 hours in advance.

site_schedule.schedule: Administrative Office: Mon-Fri 8am-3pm -- Bus Terminal: Mon-Fri 7am-5pm

site_eligibility: Living within Marion city limits -- With a documented disability that impacts transportation -- Able to get to and from the bus without assistance -OR- Able to get to and from the bus with the assistance of a personal caregiver

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Grant County, Superior Court 3 handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Grant County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Grant County  -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Grant County
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Grant County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Grant County Courts

agency_desc: A nonprofit child and family advocacy agency with services throughout Indiana.
service_description: Offers statewide virtual training for persons interested in becoming licensed for foster care. Foster parents receive 24-hour staff support, counseling services, financial reimbursement, support groups, and respite care. Eligible candidates must be physically and emotionally able to handle challenges presented. Both single persons and married couples are welcome.
site_details: Visit website to complete online interest form, register for upcoming pre-service training dates, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 21 or older -- Able to pass a criminal history, child abuse, and sexual abuse registry check -- Able to meet state foster care licensing requirements

agency_desc: Provides community health services throughout Indiana.
service_description: Offers behavioral and primary health care, including general, gynecological, and school/sports/employment exams, disease management, laboratory testing, and immunizations to patients of all ages.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment for services or financial needs assessment (if applicable).

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that coordinates volunteer services to help with selective, minor home repair projects for households within the county.
service_description: Matches area volunteers with requests for home maintenance and small home repair projects throughout DeKalb County. (THEY DO NOT REPAIR OR DO ROOFING) Depending on available volunteers, assistance may be available for yard work, painting, cleaning, snow shoveling and electrical or plumbing work. A wait list often applies for new requests. Referrals to other resources, such as financial counseling, may be given.
taxonomy_name: Home Maintenance and Minor Repair Services
nameLevel4: Home Maintenance and Minor Repair Services
site_details: Call or visit https://app.neighborlink.org/request-help/ to request assistance.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides hazardous material management and recycling services.

Grant County households (no businesses)

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance use issues and their families. Also includes intensive outpatient services and drug screenings.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.

agency_desc: A designated community mental health center for Blackford and Grant County, offering a range of mental health and addiction treatment services.
service_description: Offers treatment services for persons experiencing compulsive gambling problems. Treatment includes specialized assessment, individualized treatment plan, and one-on-one counseling.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit website to schedule an initial assessment. -- For after-hours emergencies or concerns, call the crisis line.

site_schedule.name: Gambling Addiction Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 8am-8pm; Fri 8am-noon -- Crisis Services: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Experiencing a gambling addiction

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Grant County.
service_description: Maintains the Grant County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: To visit: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Conducts local health fairs, provides health education services to the public, and maintains the lending library and other information resources for the County.
site_details: Call for information about arranging a group presentation.
site_eligibility: Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County
Open

Open -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

Open -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.
Age 19 or older -- Open
Open -- Age 6 months or older
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides subsidized, income-based rental apartments in Grant County to eligible families and persons who are elderly or disabled. Applications are accepted on a walk-in basis. A wait list is maintained when all units are full. Rent amount is equal to 30% of the resident's adjusted gross income.
site_details: Call for information or visit the website to apply; walk in to complete paperwork to be added to the wait list.
site_eligibility: Low income -- Priority given to persons 62 and older or with disabilities -- US citizens and eligible immigrants -- No rent or judgments owed to the Marion Housing Authority
Income guidelines will be reviewed once application reaches the top of the wait list. Preference is given to working families.

agency_name: MEALS ON WHEELS OF GRANT COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that delivers nutritional meals to the residences of those unable to provide such for themselves due to illness or disability.
site_name: MEALS ON WHEELS OF GRANT COUNTY
service_description: Delivers a cold lunch and a hot, evening meal each weekday to homebound individuals who are unable to cook for themselves. Regular and special diets are available. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to arrange a phone interview; clients will be asked to provide the name of an emergency contact and their physician. -- Agency may have a waiting list depending on availability of volunteer drivers.
site_eligibility: Homebound due to age or disability -- Unable to prepare own meals

service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in and take a number; two shoppers at a time. No children. Mask required.
site_eligibility: Living in Gas City, Jonesboro, or Mill Township (46928, 46933, 46938, and 46953) -- Not used this pantry within the past 30 days

agency_desc: A nonprofit healthcare organization that provides a range of physical and mental health services.
site_name: MERIDIAN HEALTH SERVICES - MARION - EAST SECOND STREET
service_description: Provides counseling to individuals, couples, and families struggling with depression, anxiety, stress, relationship problems, and other intellectual and mental health issues. Level of care is based on assessment. Sliding scale fees are available for income-eligible clients.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Low income
Ages 3-17 -- Low income

agency_desc: A nonprofit healthcare organization that provides a range of physical and mental health services.
site_name: MERIDIAN HEALTH SERVICES - MARION - NORTH WESTERN AVENUE
service_description: Offers affordable primary health care for uninsured and underinsured people. Services include family practice, pediatrics, sexually transmitted disease screenings, women's health services, laboratory testing, immunizations, diabetes treatment, asthma treatment, and patient education.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access. Maintains a Grant County history museum at this location.
site_details: Call or walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, use in-house services, or visit the website for more information. www.marion.lib.in.us
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living, working, or own property in the city of Marion in Grant County

agency_desc: A nonprofit hospital providing inpatient and outpatient services including diagnosis, treatment, prevention, and education.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from an Indiana Marion General provider. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income.
site_details: Call the Patient Financial Services office to request a Financial Assistance Policy (FAP) application, or download the application from the website. Completed application and required documents may be returned by mail or in person to the Patient Financial Services office.
site_eligibility: Received medically necessary health care services from a Marion General provider (or guarantor of someone who received such services) -- At or below 300% of the Federal Poverty Level -- Uninsured or under insured

site_eligibility: Open -- Pregnant women

agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
service_description: Builds and rehabilitates homes for eligible low-income persons in Grant County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through an affordable loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment for an information session to receive an application; may need to leave a message.
site_eligibility: Worked in Grant County for at least 1 full year -- Household income between 30%-60% of area median -- Stable employment or other source of income for at least one year -- Currently have reasonably good credit

service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Marion in Grant County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Marion city dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12
